results.title: The Commonwealth
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated film describing the structure of the Commonwealth of Nations, touching on co-operation in trade, industry and education and showing the common heritage of British ideas and institutions uniting peoples of diverse cultures. Commentary by Peter Haigh.

results.title: The Common cold
results.brief_description: Illustrates the facts known about the common cold, its care, and secondary infections that may grow out of it. Tells the story of a boy who contracts a cold and visits his doctor for treatment and advice. Reveals by means of the doctor’s illustrated explanation, why the common cold is serious and how it should be treated.

results.title: The Commandos
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Shows the tough training which makes CMF commandos: unarmed defence, cross-country fitness tests, cliff-climbing, parachute-jumping, canoeing and swimming. Includes an exercise in which commandos attach an “enemy strong-point” by sea and air.

results.title: The Coming of darkness
results.brief_description: Seventh in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Discusses the two world wars and the events in Germany, Italy, China, Japan and Russia which were contributing factors. Contends that both were capitalist wars in which workers were fighting workers. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Columbia River
results.brief_description: A survey of the Columbia River System, the world’s largest single source of hydroelectric power. Shows the multi-purpose dams, discusses US-Canadian agreements for further development, and explains the value of the waterway in irrigation, navigation and flood control.

results.title: The Colour of Pomegranates; Legend of the Suram Fortress
results.creator_credit: Sergo Paradjanov and Armenfilm U S S R
results.brief_description: The Colour of Pomegranates is a stream of religious poetic and local iconography of astonishing beauty, based on the work of Armenian poet Sayat Nova. “Legend of the Suram fortress” is set in Georgia and was Paradjanov’s first film after eleven years enforced confinement. It is based on a Georgian legend and continues the tension of Paradjanov’s earlier works concerning free will and predestination. Dedicated to Georgian warriors, it is a bold metaphor for Georgia’s independence from “Mother Russia”.
results.title_for_label: The Colour of Pomegranates; Legend of the Suram Fortress

results.title: The Colour of life
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Guy Glover and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film probes the perennial miracle of the growth of a seedling, the seasonal upsurge of life in a forest giant, and the mysterious alchemy of a single leaf. Presented in magnified dimension through time-lapse photography and animated diagrams, a maple leaf and segments of a tree serve to illustrate the physiological processes that go on in all plants.

results.title: The Colonies and Britain
results.creator_credit: Colonial Office and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the part played by Britain in making her colonies, particularly those in Africa, technically and economically ready for self-government. Illustrates how the Colonial Office is taking measures in Africa to fight disease, plague and ignorance, how the valuable resources of the colonies are being surveyed and how the necessary technical equipment is being supplied to develop these resources for the benefit of the peoples of the area.

results.title: The Colonel comes to Japan
results.brief_description: Provides a fascinating look at the highly successful marketing of the Kentucky Fried Chicken product in Japan, noting the modifications to the standard American approach adopted to suit the Japanese business philosophy and life style. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Colonel
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Jenifer Hooks and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An army colonel, having outlived his usefulness to the revolution, is imprisoned. Refusing to sign a false confession, he is eventually forced into a position of choice - his principles or his life.
